days.activity: Poem to Enjoy and Limerick Challenge

days.instructions: It's the STA Bake-Off Challenge Think you can do better than this year's winner, the baby-faced assassin Peter Sawkins? Well here's your chance to show us. We want you to create a cake, a cookie or a doughnut that looks like our very own ON IT emoji. Post your landscape photos of you and your creation in the Advent2020 channel. Winning shot makes it to the Wall of Awesome.

Kirsty McIntosh was looking for an upbeat, Scottish, techy tune for the podcast and co-host Graham Johnston let slip his brother-in-law had a band, Whisky Kiss. He gave us permission to use 'Jock's Revenge (Hold)'. We know you like it, so here's a chance to enjoy their great video and hear the whole song. Not for nothing have they been described as: 'The best ceilidh band in the World' (at HebCelt). Thank you Whisky Kiss!

They say an army marches on its stomach. At the Scottish Tech Army, volunteers Kim Anderson and Riccy Clark worked with Edinburgh Community Food to help edit recipe videos when they couldn't hold cookery classes. Here's one for you to try - post your (landscape) photos in the #advent-2020 channel on Slack, or for added fun why not set up a Zoom dinner party with some of your fellow volunteers? Bon Appetit!
Got a perfect pooch? Brilliant budgie? Coolest Cat? Let's see your pet pics! Post your beauties (snapped in landscape of course) in the Advent2020 channel. Best one gets on the Wall of Awesome.

days.activity: White Stripe Donuts - Seven Nation Army/Caledonia

days.instructions: It is the season of good cheer, Goodness knows we need it this year.  A video is what we need, To spread some joy as one good deed. We can’t do this face to face, So share your messages in this space. Mark the calendar day by day, To wait to hear what we all have to say. You have ten days to get it right, Your deadline’s 20th at midnight.

There’s nothing like a breath of fresh air to clear the mind and soothe the spirit. Take a trip outside and send us a photo from round your way. Keep it landscape and keep it festive! Best one joins the Wall of Awesome.

Origami, the Japanese art of paper folding, is full of symbolism. They say if you make 1000 paper cranes you'll be granted a wish. If you don't have time, try out some of these festive alternatives. Have fun - and remember, post your favourite and see if you can get on the Wall of Awesome.
